text: Unarchive <#CDGHCPDKL|themes-challenge> soon? Or new channel? :smile: Wondering if there’s a way to register for the event as both a single user and team. i.e. My company wants to work on an entry, but I might also want to work on a solo entry in my free time. I also want to make sure it’s not against the rules to do this.

Hi everyone!
I created a workflow using webhook module and I have some questions about it.
1. If I trigger for 10 clients, is a single file generated with all these contacts, or 1 for each totaling 10 files?
2. If it's a single file, can I get HubSpot to download an example to check the format? If not, can you send me one? 3. If a single file is generated, there is some limit on the number of contacts, that is,
3. if you reach this limit, is a second file generated with the rest of the contacts? Thanks
good point on unarchiving that channel, will do that now. I will also ask internally on your question :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks, AJ!
Channel is now open

Hi everyone!
About webpush, where I get the API documentation for integraton?
Tks!
x-posting this here: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1634130544085900?thread_ts=1633466315.075400&cid=CEQQ9NFK2>

Hey <@U02HMG3MJ90>, we have some information about workflow webhooks in <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows|these docs>, including an example of the request format in <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/webhook_information|this doc>. You could also use something like <https://webhook.site> to generate a webhook URL that will receive the request and show you what it looks like (this is <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows#test-your-webhook|covered in our docs here>).

As for the question about number of requests, each contact gets its own request. So in your example, 10 requests would be made.

Thanks a bunch Angus!!!
This content helped me a lot!!!

Hey Dustin, just to follow up, per the rules, teams and individuals are eligible to participate.

There is nothing that would prevent an individual from working on the entry for a team as well as their own separate entry.

Teams have to pick an individual representative to submit the entry on behalf of the team. I would recommend, in order to keep things simple, you should have someone else submit the team entry if you are also planning on entering your own.
another general question: where the “saved sections” goes? i cant see it in the design manager or anywhere
<@U6Z3FRJ2D> I think they only exist in that menu when clicking the purple + button to you add them
Does anyone have experience using custom objects to hold "article" style content. Something with lots of fields, paragraphs, text heavy?
I'm wondering if the editing experience is reasonable. I'm not a huge fan of rich text fields in general so it would likely be just a few of those and lots of regular text fields
it could be very very very usefull to our dev team to see the file and use it in new templates without “redo” what other people already did
You can use the coded "reusable sections" for that (but you have to build them separately)
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas/sections#reusable-sections>
yeah i know, but since our mkt team is building new ones from the editor view, it could help us just to see the final code from our end…. <@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6> :eyes:

Hey Roberto, when you say:
> it could help us just to see the final code from our end
Are you referring to the generated HTML output or the `DND_*` type code that gets output from it?
Paid Slack accounts can get an email address for a channel. You could add that email address as a subscriber and it would send a copy of the newsletter to the Slack channel.

The dnd code. I'm thinking: right now we are working heavy on themes and all of our clients have “yours” but we only made like 12 templates to start and after some time they add “reusable sections” by they're mkt team and say to us.. “can you make me a template with this sections and x things”… it could help us a lot just to take that code and use it in a new template or “call” that section in the code
ah ok, makes sense, I will pass this back to the team for something requested. I’ll keep you updated if I hear back.
<@UDHT6N5SM> editing experience is exactly like editing contacts/companies/deals
to be clear, you won't have rich text fields as an option

<@UDHT6N5SM> <@U02502HG5JR> we currently have a limited BETA for a rich text CRM property :no_mouth:

If you (or anyone) are interested, feel free to share your use case and DM me an account ID!
whaaaaa!! that's awesome!

<@U2H3TT8F2> for what it’s worth, in a similar vein, being able to back into DND snippets based off of sections created on the page editor would be HUGE. I feel like custom coding DND areas is really the slowest part of the entire HubSpot dev process. Ive found it much faster to provide blank templates and build “templates” by just dragging modules around on the page and having clients clone those pages instead of always building them actual templates with the content and modules baked in. But if I could build the page out in the page editor and then generate hubl markup for that specific DND section or DND Area that would be pretty darn dope.
<@U2H3TT8F2> What BJ said. +1
initial impression is that it works pretty well
it would nice if I could make that column that contains it twice as wide
Cc <@UA886MF42>
Thank you BJ and Andrey, that's awesome feedback to hear! I'll pass that along also.
thats REALLY MUCH BETTER IDEA
Hi everyone, I've added huspot script form on our wordpress elementor website. However, I'm seeing duplicate forms. Anyone has this issue before? Thanks
